oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Diversity-Oriented Synthesis of Biaryl Derivatives Using Cross-Enyne Metathesis, Diels-Alder Reaction, and Suzuki-Miyaura Cross-Coupling as Key Steps
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KOTHA, S
SEEMA, V
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: RING-CLOSING METATHESIS
OLEFIN-METATHESIS
CLAISEN REARRANGEMENT
ORGANIC-SYNTHESIS
ASYMMETRIC CATALYSIS
EFFICIENT SYNTHESIS
NATURAL-PRODUCTS
DESIGN
ACID
HETEROCYCLES
biaryl derivatives
cross-enyne metathesis
Suzuki-Miyaura cross-coupling
diversity-oriented synthesis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Biaryl derivatives have been prepared by utilizing cross-enyne metathesis, Diels-Alder reaction followed by aromatization. These biaryl derivatives are further functionalized via Suzuki-Miyaura cross-coupling reaction to generate functionalized terphenyl derivatives.
